page.title: 02The School in Kimpton
page.content: In 1849 it was a church school run by the vicar and his wife,it was made a state school in 1947.It used to be smaller than it is at present,60 children divided into 3 classes.There are now 175 children divided into 7 classes,3 of which are infants and four are juniors.There is also the original infants' building which is still used for teaching.The school grounds are made up of two playing fields and two playgrounds. Activities in the school include: Harvest Festival,Christmas Concerts and a Carol Service.In the Spring term the netball and football teams play some matches if the bad weather is over.The summer term includes school journeys to various parts of the country,a Sports Day in June and swimming for the top 2 classes.A 6 week Summer holiday begins in July.
